page.title: 04ROADS
page.content: {ROADS.}The M5 runs near our school and all day and every day it is very busy with cars and lorries moving North and South. We did intend to camp out one night and make a long census of the traffic but the weather was so bad that we had to cancel the idea. On our journeys around we made quick counts of traffic and at one time there was a vehicle every second. We also had an A road from Cheltenham to Tewkesbury and Gloucester but these were not as busy as the motorway except at peak times with people travelling to and from work. In between these major roads there were many B and C roads. These were very quiet except for peak periods. There was a coach depot and a sewage farm in the area and their traffic was too big really for the small roads. Some farmers' delivery lorries also were too heavy.
